## ğŸ Getting Started <a name = "getting_started"></a>

Each note will be included in the folder that contains the modules.

### Prerequisites

Knowledge about Kubernetes

## Basic commands <a name = "basic_commands"></a>

Basic commands to view the status of the cluster
```
kubectl get <resource> <name> -n <namespace>
kubectl get pods
kubectl get services
kubectl get nodes
kubectl get deployments
```
You can describe the resource with the following commands:
```
kubectl describe <resource> <name> -n <namespace>
```
All the deployments will have labels with the name of the module.
We can view logs of the deployment with the following command:
```
kubectl logs <pod> -n <namespace>
kubectl logs -l <label> -n <namespace> --max-log-requests=<number>
```
All other commands are explained in the [Kubernetes documentation](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tutorials/kubectl/).
